Welcome to run4v’s documentation!¶

Welcome to the documentation of run4v.

run4v was originally conceived tu run VASP programs, however it can be used elsewhere.

Class structure¶

Job runner¶

class run4v.Runner¶

Class managing all jobs, it will run one job after another.

firstJob = None¶
getFirstJob()¶
jobs = []¶
run()¶

Run the runner

setFirstJob(job)¶
verbose = True¶
vprint(something)¶

Job structure¶

class run4v.Job(script='', folder='.', dependencies=[], prevDependencies={}, extDependencies={}, next=None, prev=None, verbose=True, execute=True)¶

This class is the main core of the module, each job must instantiate a Job object.

Parameters:folder (str) – Where the job should be run and where all dependencies and output should appear.
cd(folder='-')¶
controlDependencies()¶
controlDirectory()¶
controlExtDependencies()¶
controlPrevDependencies()¶
controlRun()¶

In the case that a run script was given, this function controls that the run script exists.

getCommand()¶
getNext()¶

Get next job

getPath(depName)¶
getPrev()¶

Get previous job

noExecute()¶
prepare()¶
Prepare data for the running of the VASP program:
  1. Look at the prevDependencies to copy the needed files from the prev object into the folder
  2. Look at the dependencies names to see if we have all dependencies
run()¶

This function runs the job. If ‘execute=False’ then the job will not be run, maybe because you have already run it and you just want to run the next jobs

runScript()¶
setCommand(cmd)¶
setFolder(folder)¶

Change folder after initializing.

setNext(obj)¶

This function sets the next job of the current instance and also sets the current instance as the previous job of the “obj”. So the name is misleading regarding the fact that the function does more than setting the next job, it sets the previous job of the “obj” argument.

Parameters:obj (Instance of run4v.Job.) – Next job.
setPidFile()¶
setPrev(obj)¶
Parameters:obj (Instance of run4v.Job.) – Next job.
setPrevDependencies(dependencies={})¶
Set the dependencies we need from the previous job
dependencies = {
“prevDependencyName”:”newName”, ..

}

vprint(something)¶

Utils¶

Automatically generated files¶

class run4v.VASPFile(raw_content='', fileName='GenericVaspFile', path='.', autogen=False, verbose=True)¶

This class is the base class for all sorts of files which should be generated through a python script.

Parameters:
  • fileName (str) – Name to be used for the generated file.
  • raw_content (str) – If provided, the contents of the generated file will be raw_content.
  • path (str) – Path of the file to be generated.
  • autogen (bool) – Whether or not to generate the file as soon as the instance is created.
  • verbose (bool) – Whether or not output the vprint output.
createFile(path='')¶

Generate the file.

Parameters:path (str) – Possibility to override the path attribute of the class, if given, it resets the path of the file.
exists()¶

Checks for the existence of the generated file, useful for scripting and debugging.

getContents()¶

This function should be overriden by child classes. It returns the contents that should be written to the generated file. Here if raw_content is provided it will simply return the raw_content.

rm()¶

Simply remove the generated file.

vprint(something)¶

Verbose printing, it prints something if verbose is activated.

Parameters:something (all) – Something to print.
